page.title: 20Aid for starving Ethiopians
page.content: In 1984 we heard the tragic news of the starving people of Ethiopia. Our class raised money to help them by having a "Wear your own clothes day" when we paid 10p for each piece of clothing that was not school uniform.Then we made cakes and biscuits to sell and we raffled a huge teddy bear. A lot of us bought a record made by pop star Bob Geldorf who formed a group called Band- Aid. It was made up of pop groups such as Wham, Spandau Ballet, U2 and many others.The song was about the famine and it explained how many people starve and how lucky we are. So many records were sold that the record shot to No.1 in the Pop Charts. It made thousands of pounds to help Ethiopia. It was a good record and it made young people feel very sad about starving people and made them want to help as much as they could.
